key_points: Gabby Petito's death has deeply affected her hometown of Blue Point, Long Island.
The community is mourning by placing blue ribbons around town and planning a special ceremony.
Petito was found dead in a Wyoming park after a trip with her boyfriend, Brian Laundrie.
A billboard in memory of Gabby has been erected near her family home.
Local trees are adorned with teal blue ribbons to remember Petito, matching the color of her eyes.
The ribbon tribute was organized by the Johnny Mac Foundation in memory of Petito.
The foundation was created in honor of FDNY firefighter John McNamara, a 9/11 first responder.
Petito's mother, Nichole Schmidt, has close ties to the Johnny Mac Foundation.
A "Shine a Light for Gabby" candle lighting ceremony is planned for Friday night.
The event aims to be intimate, with no mass gathering encouraged.
